title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Public Finance Managers

content.rendered:
What is a Public Finance Manager?

Public Finance Managers are concerned with all aspects of a country’s budgeting process.

Where does a Public Finance Manager work?

  • Charities
  • Schools
  • Government agencies

How much does a Public Finance Manager make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Public Finance Manager is $57,141.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Public Finance Managers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Finance majors
  • Accounting majors
  • Business majors
  • Economics majors
Search roles on on Handshake.

Public Finance Manager skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Public Finance Managers succeed in their work:

  • Background in auditing and budgeting
  • Understanding of monetary challenges in communities

What are some common questions about Public Finance Managers?

Q: What is public finance?

A: Public finance studies the role of the government in the economy.
